newsitem.title: INDIA: India RBI frees limits on commercial paper issue.
newsitem.headline: India RBI frees limits on commercial paper issue.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said it lifted some restrictions on the amount of commercial paper issues by Indian firms.
Indian firms are now allowed to issue commercial papers (CP), subject to the rule that the issue amount would have to be reduced from the permissible working capital limit.
"After the introduction of the 'loan system,' the amount of commercial paper is required to be carved out of the 'cash credit component' of the working capital limit," RBI said.

"In view of the further reduction in the 'cash credit component,' it has been decided that the amount of commercial paper that can be issued will not henceforth be restricted to the 'cash credit component.'
Detailed operating instruction are being issued separately, RBI said in its monetary policy for the second half of 1996/97 (April-March) announced on Saturday.
